channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Lawyers claim phone may have distracted suspect
item.description: The claim appears in court documents for a US hearing into damages for Harry Dunn's fatal crash.

item.title: Factory worker Haroldas Bugaila found guilty of murdering baby son
item.description: Haroldas Bugaila shook his 11-week-old son to death after a row with his girlfriend, a court hears.

item.title: Greece wildfires: British firefighters help tackle 'unprecedented' blazes
item.description: A team helping to tackle Greek wildfires face an "explosive mixture" of conditions, an officer says.

item.title: Cornwall policeman who took dead person's cash is sacked
item.description: The police officer treated the £105 "as his own", says the force after a disciplinary hearing.

item.title: London's Tower Bridge stuck open after technical failure
item.description: Police warn drivers to avoid roads around the famous London landmark after the technical failure.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai returns to UK from Tokyo
item.description: Galal Yafai was met with cheers and chanting as he arrived at London Heathrow Airport from Tokyo.

item.title: Downing Street march to save alpaca Geronimo
item.description: More than 100,000 people sign a petition calling on Boris Johnson to halt the alpaca's execution.

item.title: Armed forces personnel come out for funeral of WW2 veteran
item.description: Douglas Tune's carer posts an appeal on social media for funeral guests and gets a huge response.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman operation 'an effective result'
item.description: Sudesh Amman was shot dead by surveillance officers after stabbing two people in south London.

item.title: Missing hillwalker: Search for Frank Smith at Ben Cruachan
item.description: Frank Smith, from Nottingham, has not returned from a planned walk up 1,126m Ben Cruachan.

item.title: Peter Kay: Cancer patient 'honoured' to inspire comic's comeback gig
item.description: The comedian returned to the stage to raise money to help pay for student Laura Nuttall's treatment.

item.title: Birmingham riots: Tariq Jahan reflects 10 years on
item.description: Tariq Jahan says he forgives the men who killed his son during the 2011 riots in Birmingham.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Chorley friendship group made me smile again, says widower
item.description: Gerald says he felt lonely but has "never looked back" since joining a Chorley friendship group.

item.title: How golf helped a Holocaust survivor
item.description: The club was set up for Jewish people to enjoy golf and is about to celebrate its 90th anniversary.

item.title: Chelsea's Ivy Asia restaurant sorry for 'culturally insensitive' advert
item.description: The video features women dressed as geishas being pulled in a rickshaw to the restaurant.

item.title: West Mercia PC travelling at high speed before fatal crash
item.description: Jamie Holloway was responding to an emergency call from colleagues, a court hears.

item.title: Search continues for missing Lulworth Cove diver off Dorset
item.description: Carvalho da Silveira was last seen in the water on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Daughter of 'Robocop' PC becomes Nottinghamshire Police officer
item.description: Rachel Evans says she was inspired to join Nottinghamshire Police after her dad made 309 arrests in a year.

item.title: Hampshire murder detective forged statement, court hears
item.description: The officer is accused of forging a witness statement in the Lucy-Anne Rushton murder investigation.

item.title: Jack Grealish: Manchester City midfielder says he 'teared up' in Aston Villa exit
item.description: Jack Grealish says his departure from Aston Villa for Manchester City was as emotional as Lionel Messi's final Barcelona press conference and that he "teared up" as he left the team.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root coping well with pressure - Chris Silverwood
item.description: The rest of England's batters must "come to the party" to ease the workload on captain Joe Root, says head coach Chris Silverwood.

item.title: Tom Pidcock and Adam Yates to ride Vuelta a Espana for Ineos
item.description: Olympic mountain bike gold medallist Tom Pidcock will race in the Vuelta a Espana for Ineos Grenadiers alongside fellow Briton Adam Yates.

item.title: Shafali Verma keeps Phoenix's Hundred hopes alive with Fire win
item.description: India's teenage superstar Shafali Verma crunches a rapid half-century as Birmingham Phoenix keep their slim hopes alive with an empathic victory over Welsh Fire in the women's Hundred.
